definitions: a person who concentrates primarily on a particular subject or activity; a person highly skilled in a specific and restricted field

examples.text: he is a specialist in psychometric testing
the study was undertaken by a market-research specialist

shortDefinitions: person who concentrates primarily on particular subject or activity

definitions: a physician highly trained in a particular branch of medicine

examples.text: her doctor thought her allergy was psychosomatic, but he sent her to a specialist

shortDefinitions: person highly trained in particular branch of medicine

definitions: (in the US Army) an enlisted person of one of four grades (specialist 4, equivalent to the rank of corporal, being the most junior, specialist 7, equivalent to sergeant first class, being the most senior) who has technical or administrative duties but does not exercise command.
shortDefinitions: enlisted person of one of four grades who has technical or administrative duties but does not exercise command

definitions: possessing or involving detailed knowledge or study of a restricted topic

examples.text: the project may involve people with specialist knowledge

shortDefinitions: possessing or involving detailed knowledge or study of restricted topic

definitions: concentrating on a restricted field, market, or area of activity
shortDefinitions: concentrating on restricted field, market, or area of activity
